properties.areaDesc: Lake Huron from Harbor Beach to Port Sanilac 5NM Off Shore to US/Canadian border; Harbor Beach to Port Sanilac MI; Lake Huron from 5NM east of Mackinac Bridge to Presque Isle Lt  to the US/Canadian border beyond 5 NM from shore; Port Sanilac to Port Huron MI; Lake Huron from Port Austin to Harbor Beach 5NM Off Shore to the US/Canadian border; Lake Huron from Port Sanilac to Port Huron 5NM Off Shore to US/Canadian border; Port Austin to Harbor Beach MI; Lake Huron from Sturgeon Point to Alabaster MI 5NM off shore to US/Canadian border; Lake Huron from Presque Isle Lt. to Sturgeon Point  MI 5NM off shore to US/Canadian border
properties.headline: Gale Watch issued January 9 at 4:00PM EST until January 12 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Detroit/Pontiac MI
properties.description:
* WHAT...During the Gale Warning, expect sustained winds up to
33 knots from the south with gusts up to 40 knots. The largest
significant waves will be 14 feet with a potential maximum
wave height of 20 feet. During the Gale Watch, expect
sustained winds up to 36 knots from the northeast with gusts
up to 47 knots. The largest significant waves will be 13 feet
with a potential maximum wave height of 19 feet.

* WHERE...Portions of Lake Huron.

* WHEN...During the Gale Warning, the maximum winds are expected
around 7 PM EST Thursday with the largest waves expected
around 8 PM EST Thursday. During the Gale Watch, the maximum
winds are expected around 11 PM EST Saturday with the largest
waves expected around 1 AM EST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Strong winds will cause hazardous waves which could
capsize or damage vessels and reduce visibility.
properties.instruction:
Mariners should alter plans to avoid these hazardous conditions.
Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course, and/or secure the
vessel for severe conditions.

NWSheadline: GALE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...GALE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON
